description.value: Relevant patient’s allergies and/or intolerance conditions. At a minimum, it should list currently active and any relevant historical allergies and adverse reactions. NOTE ‘Alerts’ was used to describe this Section in the eHN guidance -lines, but ‘Alerts’ are far more general and are not regarded here as a synonym. ‘Alerts’ more generally are recorded under ‘Problems’ in this iteration.

purpose.value: To inform the treatment and care provisioning of an attending clinician to identify problem or to avoid adverse events arising from action taken. At a minimum, it should list currently active and any relevant historical allergies and adverse reactions.

human.value: This is a required IPS Section and must be in the document. Unknown and known absence should be stated explicitly.
If ‘there is content’ then Allergies and Intolerances list SHALL be non-empty AND the content status SHALL be omitted. (i.e. it is not Required)
If content status records absence then Allergies and Intolerances list SHALL be omitted
End Date SHALL be given if Clinical Status indicates ‘resolved’

definition.value: As this IPS Section is mandatory for conformance, information about “known absence of allergies” or no information about allergies is required to be stated. Known Content will be accompanied by the conditional list of Allergies and intolerances.

If allergies present then they shall be listed else give explicit reasons for why none are recorded. An ordered list comprising the name, code, a description of the Allergy/intolerance and Agent details for each Allergy/intolerance.
